fileheader.author: Gijs de Rooy

reference.author: The Boeing Company
reference.title: 747-469/-4F6 Flight Crew Operations Manual, Philipine Airlines

reference.author: The Boeing Company
reference.title: The Simulation of a Large Jet Transport Aircraft Volume I: Mathematical Model

reference.author: The Boeing Company
reference.title: The Simulation of a Jumbo Jet Transport Aircraft Volume II: Modeling Data

reference.author: Koray Kosari, Seher Durmaz, Elbrous M. Jafarov
reference.title: Longitudinal Dynamics Analysis of Boeing 747-400

fileheader.documentation:
- http://www.aoe.vt.edu/~mason/Mason_f/M96SC02.pdf (Willian H. Mason) :
CG range : 13.0 / 33.0 % MAC.
- http://www.bh.com/companions/034074152X/appendices/data-a/table-3/table.htm :
Horizontal tail : area 136.60 m2, arm 32.50 m, 1/4 chord sweep 32.00 m. Vertical tail : area 77.10 m2, arm 30.00 m, 1/4 chord sweep 45.00 m. V2 177 kt, Vapp 141 kt, Vne/Mme 445 kt / 0.95 Mach.
- http://www.airliners.net/discussions/tech_ops/read.main/52218/6/#ID52218 :
V2 190 kt (max takeoff load), climbs without flaps only at V2 + 100 kt. VREF 154 kt (max landing load).

mass_balance.documentation:
- operational empty weight = 394088 lb - empty CG at 23 % MAC (no payload)
inertia from http://www.wseas.us/e-library/conferences/2007istanbul/papers/557-095.pdf

ground_reactions.documentation: - gear height determined by 3D model, supposed at scale. - additonal contact points for crash detection, when gear retracted.

propulsion.documentation: - tank arm and lateral position is a guess : must fit inside the wing, in front of gear well; and close of aero reference point to minimize the CG shift. - 1 US gal = 6.7 lb.

function.name: fcs/steer-rear-deg[2]
function.description: Steering command for left body gear

function.name: fcs/steer-rear-deg[3]
function.description: Steering command for right body gear

aerodynamics.documentation: Not sure if these are negative values?
CL = CL0 + ... + dCL_inboard_elevators + dCL_outboard_elevators + dCL_outboard_ailerons + dCL_landing_gear + dCL_ground_effect

function.name: aero/coefficient/CL_star
function.description: Lift coefficient of first six terms

axis.name: LIFT
axis.documentation: CL = CL0 + ... + dCL_inboard_elevators + dCL_outboard_elevators + dCL_outboard_ailerons + dCL_landing_gear + dCL_ground_effect

function.name: aero/coefficient/CD0
function.description: Basic drag coefficient for the rigid airplane

function.name: aero/coefficient/dCD_stabilizer
function.description: Change in basic drag coefficient due to change in stabilizer angle

function.name: aero/coefficient/dCDspoilers
function.description: Change in drag coefficient due to spoilter or speedbrake deflection

function.name: optimum-cruise-alt-ft
function.description: Optimum cruise altitude (long range cruise; M 0.86)
